content.description:
One of the best problems of the grade in the park. 

  Start on the right facing 3 finger jug at the base of the arete. Move up through the bulge to double pinches. Figure out some sneaky feet to get up to the next pair of holds, a slopy pinch and a good edge. Set your feet and make a scary move to the angling lip feature. Follow the lip up and right to top out where you can squeeze past the wall behind.
content.protection: Plenty of pads and a couple of spotters.
content.location: From the Ginsu Wall turn around and look towards the campground. Snakecharmer is in the smaller looking boulders to the right of the open view to ground level. Head over to those boulders and turn right through a corridor, problems on both sides, and then right again into a small cave. Snakecharmer climbs the arete on the right side of the cave entrance.

content.description:
This is a worth while problem if you are in the area and care to crush some small edges. The climbing is pretty straight forward with no trickery. 

  SDS and pull on thin edges up to the start of Ginsu Wall and finish that problem. 

  May feel easy for those with small and or strong fingers.
content.protection: Pads and spotter, same notes as for Ginsu Wall about the landing area.
content.location: This is a sit start to Ginsu Wall.

content.description:
Start in slopey undercling down low and hug your way up to Blow Dryer.

 Don't know how the first ascentionist did the cruxy first move, but a proper sit-start definitely makes a difference compared to crouching, albeit not a grade harder imo.

The name might be a little presumptive but still a worthwhile problem. 

  Start sitting in an undercling down on a slabby boulder. Work up positive flakes to a big angling rail out left. Then back right to the topout. The landing follows you on this one so you are never that far off the ground.
content.protection: Pad and spotter, if you fall try to keep your feet on the wall at the start to keep yourself from sliding down the ramp.
content.location: From the Cutting Board (main wall) turn around and walk 50 yards out to a corridor on the right. The problem is on the left side of the corridor and the Snakecharmer is in the back on the right.

content.description: Great roof climb with seemingly horrific, but manageable start and finish "landings". Manageable, as in, it can be protected with good padding and spotters; but really, one should be confident in climbing in this grade range before giving this serious attempts IMHO.

Fun problem on mostly small crimps. 

  Pull on edges in the horizontals to get up to the angle change where more difficult moves are encountered getting up onto the slab.  

  This problem is moderately intimidating as the hardest moves are a little ways up and the landing is not great.
content.protection:
Pads and spotter. There is a gap in the rock at the base of this problem that is nice to have filled with a pad then another larger pad over the top.  

  It is also worth noting that there is a sharp point on the left side of this notch that can tear the cover of your pad so place pads accordingly.
content.location:
The central line on the Ginsu Wall. 

  This problem starts off of the main platform from a stand start just over a break in the rock below. Climbs pretty much straight up to the left of the right facing flake line that Banzai Knife finishes on.

content.description: Spectacular balancy arete climb! Maybe one of the best V0s in the park if flat landings are a criteria for you.
Start on obvious hueco jugs on the pocketed face.  Climb up and right into the scoop.
content.location: Exit Dragons Den near Try Hard and walk right down the slab.  Blowdryer will be in an alcove below and to your right.  Alternatively, if facing Man Gum, this climb will be downhill to your right.  Squeeze through a narrow tunnel in the boulders and it will be below you in an alcove.

content.description:
A hard start on crimps takes you up the initial face to where you can move left into the flake and over the higher landing platform. Follow the flake as it angles up and left above the higher landing area. At the end of the flake pull up to the sloping lip and make tough and intimidating moves onto the slab above. 

  The top out on this problem is not your typical Hueco Tanks finish, no jugs up there.
content.protection: Pads and spotters, you will probably want a pad or two down low for the starts and a couple more at least up on the platform for the top out.
content.location: This problem climbs the obvious flake line in the middle of the Ginsu Wall which is the centerpiece of the area. Starts from a stand down and to the right of the platform that many of the lines start from, just left of the right arete

content.description:
Less traffic that the main Dragon's Den area. Not as many problems but still some good stuff to throw yourself at. Many of the problems have less than idea landings so you will be happy that you have to take a tour to come here and therefore have many pads availible. 

  Some of the better lines are, Instant Classic V3, Ginsu Wall V4 and it's SDS Man Gum V9, Banzai Knife V6 ,Snakecharmer V7 and Whispers of Mortality V10.
